bug.author: nam-leduc
bug.summary: Confuse about dump "tessnoimages.png" when segmenting page and detect orientation.

comments.comment: At least in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract/blob/master/ccmain/osdetect.cpp#L177>osdetect</denchmark-link> it is done that way. Anyway I found out that pixSubtract(pix_binary_, pix_binary_, *photo_mask_pix) does not removed all images. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/theraysmith>@theraysmith</denchmark-link> : can you have a look at this?
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/nam-leduc>@nam-leduc</denchmark-link> , is this still an issue with latest Tesseract? We'd like to know that before releasing Tesseract 4.0.0.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/stweil>@stweil</denchmark-link> : I testing it with: tesseract i269.png i269 -c tessedit_dump_pageseg_images=1 Interesting it that it produce pdf (<denchmark-link:https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract/files/2418680/i269_debug.pdf>i269_debug.pdf</denchmark-link> ) for debugging steps and it seems it is not fixed...

Anyway I found out that pixSubtract(pix_binary_, pix_binary_, *photo_mask_pix) does not removed all images.
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/zdenop>@zdenop</denchmark-link> , Can you give an example? Probably Leptonica itself fails to identify these images. For example, Leptonica does not recognize line drawings as images.

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/amitdo>@amitdo</denchmark-link> : as you can see in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract/files/5177735/have-image_debug.pdf>have-image_debug.pdf</denchmark-link> from <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nam-leduc>@nam-leduc</denchmark-link> example (or you can use original image from this issue) - there are still image artefacts. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract/issues/269#issuecomment-687569986>Leduct patch</denchmark-link> improves debug output without effect on OCR (so it could/should be applied). <denchmark-link:https://github.com/nam-leduc>@nam-leduc</denchmark-link> : can you send PR? My original suggestion has effect on OCR and I did not test it (so it is dangerous to apply it). IMHO <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract/blob/162f3707e28102451338ced235c80ffa6f09ae40/src/textord/colfind.cpp#L146>SetupAndFilterNoise </denchmark-link> should be investigated if produces expected results.
I suggest to simplify the patch a little bit. It is not necessary to write a 2nd image for pix_binary_, so the else part can be omitted..

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/stweil>@stweil</denchmark-link> , my thinking is that if we can't find any photo from binary image, so, binary image are 'NoImages', it maybe confuse developer if we don't add 'NoImages' pdf page. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/stweil>@stweil</denchmark-link> , what do you think?
Fixed by pull request <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tesseract-ocr/tesseract/pull/3090>#3090</denchmark-link> , so closing this issue.
